info.title: Genymotion SaaS Public HTTP API
info.description:
Genymotion SaaS user documentation can be found at [docs.genymotion.com/saas](https://docs.genymotion.com/saas).

This HTTP API allows you to manage Genymotion SaaS virtual devices.

There are 3 main concepts in this API. All of them must be understood in order to able to use the it efficiently.

The first concept is **Authentication**.
An API token or JWT (JSON Web Token) must be used to authenticate the API calls.
The authentication endpoint itself does not accept an API token or JWT. In the Genymotion SaaS Public HTTP API, all
endpoints other than the authentication endpoint accept either API token or JWT authentication.

For endpoints requiring authentication, exactly one of the API token or the JWT must be provided.
If neither are provided, the API call will return a 401 Unauthorized HTTP error.
If both are provided, the API call will return a 400 Bad Request HTTP error.


The details of each authentication scheme are provided below, in [Authentication](#section/Authentication).

The second concept is the **Recipe**. A Recipe is what is needed to cook an Instance. This Recipe contains the information
about the Android system, the virtual device characteristics, and some contextual data. Genymobile provides a
variety of default Recipes, but you can create and share new ones from either the [Genymotion SaaS Portal](https://cloud.geny.io) or
from the [Genymotion Desktop software](https://www.genymotion.com/desktop/) (license required).

The third concept is the **Instance**. An Instance represents a Genymotion Virtual Device running in the Cloud. Built using
the information contained in a Recipe, an Instance can be accessed using a wide variety of tools. The current API
allows you to start and stop *disposable* Instances. A disposable Instance will always be recreated from the Recipe
when a start request is sent. When a stop request is sent, the virtual device Instance will be destroyed, and any
modifications done inside it during the run time will be lost.

post.description:
Authenticate a User, and retreive a new valid JWT.
This JWT must be provided to all other API calls in order to identify and authenticate the User executing the request.

Once logged in, simply add the `Authorization` HTTP header to all subsequents API calls.
`Authorization` HTTP header value must have the following format: `Bearer <JWT>`.

A JWT *will* expire after some time. The default validity duration is 48 hours.
It is recommended to generate a new one before running a new set of API calls.
Generating a new JWT will not invalidate previously generated JWTs.

get.description:
**This route is deprecated and will be removed in a future release.**

To avoid any service disruption, it is **mandatory** to migrate your calls to the new [List Recipe v3](#operation/listRecipesV3) route.

List all ready Recipes available for the authenticated User.
This endpoint returns 3 lists of Recipes:
- Bases Recipes, the default Recipes, provided by Genymobile and always available to all Users
- User Recipes, Recipes shared to any other User by the currently authenticated User
- Shared Recipes, Recipes shared by any other User to the currently authenticated User

post.description: This endpoint creates a new recipe from the input parameters.

x-codeSamples.source: curl -H 'Content-Type: application/json;charset=utf-8' -H 'x-api-token: <token>' --data '{ "hardware_profile_uuid": "<HWP_PROFILE_UUID>", "os_image_uuid": "<OS_IMAGE_UUID>", "parent_recipe_uuid": "<PARENT_RECIPE_UUID>", "name": "The recipe name", "description": "A description of this recipe"}' https://api.geny.io/cloud/v1/recipes

get.description:
**This route is deprecated and will be removed in a future release.**

To avoid any service disruption, it is **mandatory** to migrate your calls to the new [List Recipe v3](#operation/listRecipesV3) route.

List all Recipes available for the authenticated User.

This endpoint returns a paginated list of all Recipes.

parameters.name: source
parameters.description:
Filter by Recipe source.

Options are:
  * `official`: Recipes provided by Genymotion, available to everyone
  * `owner`: Recipes created by authenticated User
  * `sharee`: Recipes shared to authenticated User or their Organization
  * `shared`: combination of `owner` & `sharee`
  * `all`: combination of `official` & `shared`

parameters.name: status
parameters.description:
Filter by Recipe status.

Options are:
  * `ready`: Recipes you can use to start an Instance with
  * `updating`: Recipes currently being updating (cannot be used to start an Instance yet)
  * `all`: combination of `ready` & `updating`

parameters.name: type
parameters.description:
Filter by Recipe type.

Options are:
  * `system`: Recipes based on a full-fledged system
  * `app`: Recipes based on an Android application (APK)
  * `all`: combination of `system` & `app`

get.description: List all is official Recipes and Recipes of the current user.

parameters.name: source
parameters.description:
Filter by Recipe source.
Options are:
  * `official`: Recipes provided by Genymotion, available to everyone
  * `shared`: combination of recipes :
    - created by the authenticated User
    - shared to authenticated User or their Organization
  * `all`: combination of `official` & `shared`

parameters.name: arch
parameters.description:
Filter by the architecture of the related image.

If this isn't specified, `x86` and `x86_64` will be used by default.

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: Search term to search on name or uuid attributes.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page to fetch

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: Number of recipes per page

200.description: A list containing all official and related to the user recipes.

delete.summary: Delete Recipe identified by its uuid

parameters.name: uuid
parameters.description: Uuid of the recipe to retrieve

403.description: The user is not allowed to delete this recipe.

post.description:
Start a new disposable Instance from the given Recipe identified by its Uuid.

The Instance is disposable, meaning that all changes done inside it will be lost after
the Instance is stopped.

The state of the Instance returned by this call will always be CREATING.

requestBody.description: Data used to start new disposable Instance

400.description: An instance with the same name already exist for user.

403.description: Not allowed to start an instance.

404.description: The given recipe cannot be found, or no slots are available on the platform.

get.description:
**This route is deprecated and will be removed in a future release.**

To avoid any service disruption, it is **mandatory** to migrate your calls to the new [List Instances v2](#operation/listInstances) route.

List all currently available Instances for the authenticated User.
This endpoint is deprecated. /v2/instances should be used instead.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Deprecated.

post.summary: Get a token to connect to an instance.
post.description: Returns a token to be used for connecting to an instance.

get.description:
List all currently available Instances for the authenticated User.

The following sortable fields are available:
- name (Instance name)
- created_at (Instance creation datetime)
- updated_at (Instance update datetime)
- owner (Uuid of the Instance owner)
- state (Instance state)

This endpoint is paginated.

parameters.name: organization_uuid
parameters.description: Uuid of the organization. Only an organization manager can use this filter.

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: Instance state to filter

403.description: Not allowed to list organization's instances

get.description: Retrieve an Instance identified by its Uuid.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Deprecated.

post.description:
Stop the given disposable Instance identified by its Uuid.

The Instance will automatically be destroyed right after it has been stopped.

The state of the Instance returned by this call will always be STOPPING, unless it was already in SAVING or DELETING state.
In this case, the call will succeed but the instance will continue its end-of-life cycle.

post.summary: Save a running instance in order to reuse it later
post.description: [STATEFULL] Export running instance data to make it persist over stop

parameters.name: uuid
parameters.description: UUID of the instance

204.description: The instance has successfully been saved.

403.description: The user is not allowed to save an instance.

get.summary: Retrieve Hardware Profile identified by its uuid

parameters.name: uuid
parameters.description: Uuid of the hardware profile to retrieve

403.description: The user is not allowed to request this hardware profile.

delete.summary: Delete Hardware Profile identified by its uuid

parameters.name: uuid
parameters.description: Uuid of the hardware profile to retrieve

403.description: The user is not allowed to delete this hardware profile.

get.description: List all is official Hardware Profiles and Hardware Profiles of the current user.

parameters.name: source
parameters.description:
Filter by Hardware Profile source.
Options are:
  * `official`: Hardware Profiles provided by Genymotion, available to everyone
  * `owner`: Hardware Profiles created by authenticated User
  * `all`: combination of `official` & `owner`

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: Search term to search on name attribute.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page to fetch

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: Number of hardware profiles per page

200.description: A list containing all official and related to the user hardware profiles.

post.description: This endpoint creates a new hardware profile from the input parameters.

x-codeSamples.source: curl -H 'Content-Type: application/json;charset=utf-8' -H 'x-api-token: <token>' --data '{"display_settings": {"displays": [{"width": 240, "height": 240, "density": 80, "physical_size": 1}], "hw_navigation_keys": true}, "parent_hardware_profile_uuid": <PARENT_HARDWARE_PROFILE_UUID>, "name": "The hardware profile name", "form_factor": "PHONE", "release_date": "2023-08-23"}' https://api.geny.io/cloud/v1/hardware-profiles/

get.summary: Retrieve OS Image identified by its uuid

parameters.name: uuid
parameters.description: Uuid of the OS Image to retrieve

403.description: The user is not allowed to request this OS Image.

delete.summary: Delete OS Image identified by its uuid

parameters.name: uuid
parameters.description: Uuid of the OS Image to retrieve

403.description: The user is not allowed to delete this Os Image.

get.description: List all is official OS Images and OS Images of the current user.

parameters.name: source
parameters.description:
Filter by OS Image source.
Options are:
  * `official`: OS Images provided by Genymotion, available to everyone
  * `owner`: OS Images created by authenticated User
  * `all`: combination of `official` & `owner`

parameters.name: arch
parameters.description:
Filter by the image architecture.

If this isn't specified, `x86` and `x86_64` will be used by default.

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: Search term to search on name attribute.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page to fetch

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: Number of os images per page

200.description: A list containing all official and related to the user os images.

post.description: This endpoint duplicates an OS Image from the input parameters.

parameters.name: uuid
parameters.description: Uuid of the OS Image to retrieve

get.summary: Get usage report per user for the current organization.
get.description: This endpoint allows an organization's manager to get a usage report for the current organization.

parameters.name: from_date
parameters.description: Start of the usage period.

parameters.name: to_date
parameters.description: End of the usage period.

403.description: The requester isn't allowed to access usage reports.

404.description: There was no consumption for the given period.

OrderingOA2.name: ordering
OrderingOA2.description: Use an orderable field with an optional '+' OR '-' prefix to order in the desired direction

ApiToken.description:
`x-api-token` HTTP header, with the api-token as the value.

API tokens may be created in the [Genymotion SaaS Portal](https://cloud.geny.io).

Providing an invalid API token will result in a 401 Unauthorized HTTP error.

Providing an API token on an endpoint which does not support API token authentication will result in a 403 Forbidden HTTP error.

Providing both an API token and a JWT Authorization will result in a 400 Bad Request HTTP error.
ApiToken.name: x-api-token

Bearer.description:
`Authorization` HTTP header, with `Bearer <JWT>` content format, for authentication mechanism.

Use the [Authenticate User](#operation/login) endpoint to obtain a JWT.

Providing an invalid/expired JWT will result in a 401 Unauthorized HTTP error.

Providing both a JWT Authorization and an API token will result in a 400 Bad Request HTTP error.
Bearer.name: Authorization

instance_name.description: Name of the Instance. This name must be unique per User.

rename_on_conflict.description:
In case a virtual device already exist with the same name, allow the Platform to rename the
Instance with a new, unique, name. New name will look like `instance_name` followed by some
characters generated by the Platform.

timeouts.description: Various customizable timeouts for the Instance.

global.description:
Duration after which the Instance will be stopped, no matter what. The countdown starts when the Instance goes into ONLINE/RUNNING state for the first time.
Omitting this value will make it use the organization's default global timeout.
Setting it to 0 will disable the global timeout.

inactivity.description:
Duration after which the Instance will be stopped when no connection is done on the webapp.
Omitting this value will make it use the organization default inactivity timeout.
Setting it to 0 will disable the inactivity timeout.

action.description:
Specify if the recipe should be updated in place, or if a new recipe should be created.

SAVE will update the custom recipe. SAVE can only be used if the current user is the owner of the custom recipe.
If a the image is official, a new custom image will be created. Otherwise the existing custom image will be updated.

SAVE_AS will create a new custom recipe and a new custom image.

When a new custom recipe is created, it will have the name specified by new_recipe_name. If no new_recipe_name
is specified, the new custom recipe will be named "Copy of toriginal recipe name)"

When a new custom image is created, it will have the name specified by new_os_image_name. If no new_os_image_name
is specified, the new custom image will be named "Copy of (original image name)"

new_recipe_name.description: Name of the new created recipe. Used in case of action=SAVE_AS.

new_os_image_name.description: Name of the new created OS Image. Used in case of action=SAVE and current OsImage is official, or if action=SAVE_AS.

delete_hardware_profile.description: Define if we delete the recipe hardware profile.

delete_os_image.description: Define if we delete the recipe OS image.

instance_uuid.description:
Instance uuid.

This is required to connect to instances with arm64 architecture.

token.description:
User JWT. The JWT is required for most of the API calls.
It must be passed in the `Authorization` HTTP header, using the format `Bearer <JWT>`.

group.description: Deprecated. Group of the User. Will always be absent.

base.description: Widely available Recipes, provided by Genymobile.

user.description: Recipes shared to collaborators by the authenticated User.

shared.description: Recipes shared by collaborators to the authenticated User.

updated_at.description: Last update date of the share.

organization_recipients_count.description: Count of recipient with organization type.

user_recipients_count.description: Count of user with user type.

is_official.description: If Hardware Profile is an official template

ram_size.description: Hardware Profile RAM size in Mb

data_disk_size.description: Hardware Profile data disk size in Mb

recipe_count.description: Count of recipes using this Hardware Profile

count.description: Number of total Hardware Profiles results

is_official.description: If OsImage is an official template

is_beta.description: If OsImage is a beta version

The user's email.

This field will be empty if the user no longer exists in the system.

instance_count.description: Number of devices the user has launched for the given period.

duration_seconds.description: Total duration, in seconds, of the user's device sessions for the given period.

is_organization_manager.description: Whether the user has manager access in the organization or not

front_preferences.description: Key/value store for user interface preferences such as pagination, table headers, reminders, etc.

tnc_accepted.description: True if the user has accepted the current Terms and Conditions, false otherwise.

is_default.description: Whether or not the group is the default one for the organization

global.description: Duration after which the Instance will be stopped, no matter what. The countdown starts when the Instance goes into ONLINE/RUNNING state for the first time.
